So I get trolled, flamed, lose games, called a %%%%%% and told to kill myself, and I'M the one that gets punished. Riot is a friggin joke, I'm supposed to endure death threats, racial remarks, and trolls, but if i say that they're trolling, im wrong? Is this the real world?

That doesn't answer the question at all though. There's either an offense or not, regardless of anything prior. You can't just pick someone up on parole and throw them in prison without a crime committed and say "well they were a criminal before so...." 

The only thing anyone has been able to say was that I repeated a racial slur that I had been called all game when asking the enemy team to report it. That's obviously silly since it was apparent that I was condemning the using of the word, not using against others.
Because as Tantram stated, you've been punished multiple times now, which is why it was elevated to a 14 day penalty.

That doesn't answer the question, am I in an insane asylum? Let me try to follow the line of reasoning:

"What did i do wrong?"
"You have been punished before, so you got a 14 day ban"
"Ok, but what did I do wrong this time? What was the offense"
"Well this is your 5th punishment, so clearly it needed to be escalated"

Am I just stupid here? I'm asking what I did that warranted punishment at all. Can anyone provide an answer that isn't "Well you were chat restricted in the past, so you deserve it"?

What did you do wrong? Instead of playing the game, , you were constantly arguing, and went on to troll. You typed more than you played the game. The reason I stated what I did, was because you were asking how it warranted a 14-day ban.

I read both sides of the chat log, and you are not exactly innocent.

You were intentionally trolling, trying to 'get back' at people. You even told people to report someone who up to the point had only said 1 thing to you:

'just because sion is a dick doenst mean you have to fuck over the entire team' - this was directed at you.

 You would have normally got a 10-game chat restriction. But, the penalty was escalated.

Got it, so I was the one trolling and toxic. The Sion support that left bot Lane lvl 1 and fed was fine. The syndra that intentionally fed, afked and called me a %%%%%% over and over was fine. I'm the problem. 

Message received loud and clear, I'll be conducting myself in accordance with the things I've learned today, thank you.

I think you are missing the point here.

Each person is responsible for their own behavior. Other people's behavior doesn't give you a free pass to troll them and turn the game into a chat room.
Tantram bringing down that good ol' justice hammer
Technically it _is a chat room_, though....

The game isn't a chat room, it just has one in it. If you are turning the game into a chat room that means you are no longer playing the game itself, just a small part of it that overall has very little effect on the rest of it.

I have an 80WPM ability with typing; being 32 years old and having grown up around computers and video games, and naturally being dexterous with my hands (piano player, etc), I am more than capable of holding multiple conversations in any chat while still focusing on something else completely different. E.g. 6 years as a professional Counter-Strike player (original beta, not the CS:GO crap); AOL chatrooms; writing books, et al.

Just because _I can handle it_, doesn't mean I should be penalized for some misconception about "if you're typing too much you're not playing the game!" scenario because others can't handle it.

I never said you couldn't. Riot Tantrom himself said the player was turning the match into a chat room and I was explaining  what that means. The game is not a chat room, it just has one built into it. Just like the game is not a minimap, it just has one in it.

I myself have over an 80 wpm typing speed and type more than the average player. Honestly when I am doing poorly and an enemy presents the opportunity I will kindly hold a conversation with my opponents, multiple at a time if I can, to make them spend a large amount of time typing and not playing while I am spending mere seconds. 

If you are constantly typing to your own team and causing your own team to respond back to you then you are potentially putting your own team in that situation, and if you are being toxic on top of it and putting them in a bad mood then you are signifigantly lowering your chance of winning.

> If you are constantly typing to your own team and causing your own team to respond back to you then you are potentially putting your own team in that situation

Probably because they're pretty good at tracking this stuff. The way you play, where you log in, what your bindings are, and a million other things. Riot is GOOD at finding this sort of thing out.

It's not impossible. IP addresses, playstyle similarities, computer configuration (such as graphics card and processor) similarities. All of those things help Riot make a reasonable conclusion that they're all controlled by one person.

It also didn't help that most of your accounts have pretty much the same name.

>
> There is no need to tell someone else that you're going to report the other person.

Ok, I can consent to that, possibly. However, how does that warrant a 14 day suspension?

A 14-day suspension is given after either hate speech/severe behaviour or a _series of consistent negative behaviour being shown_.
For the second one, it doesn't have to be 14-day banworthy to get a 14-day ban.

The system works based on escalation, so:
-10 game chat restriction
-25 game chat restriction
-14 day account ban
-Permanent account ban

If you've encountered the other punishments, you've worked your way up to 14-days.

You're probably right. Most of the community just wants to troll each other in any way they can, so that makes sense.

You're not wrong. And God help me, kiddo, with Jesus as my witness-- I have a goddam job and do not want to come home, turn on some vidya games and arrive to be handling some child's temper tantrum. In fact, that's so _not_ what I want that it's generally where I quit League and turn on something else (if it's bad).

But that's life, man. There's always someone out for themselves. Just wait 'til you have to start dealing with money, like actual money-- you think people are trolls for no stakes on the internet? Money makes people god-awful.

The thing is, if you start being god-awful too-- even just slightly-- you're only part of the problem. Nothing more, nothing less.

There are quite a few of us here who actually do try to help people keep from losing their accounts.  I spend more time on this section of the Boards, going through people's logs, trying to give them suggestions and help them understand the system than I do actually playing League.  

And it's not because I like seeing them flip out, or because I want to see them fail.  That's the last thing I want to see!  I hate seeing the comments from people who come in with nothing but a "ban deserved" or a "good riddance" or even the "how did you not realize this would get you punished?"  Those sorts of comments are guaranteed to put the OP in a frustrated, angry or negative frame of mind, and it automatically means that those of us who are trying to help may have to spend extra hours worth of back and forth comments to try and undo the damage done by a single "good riddance."  

Sure, there are people who come to the Boards with their bowls of popcorn and just want to read the drama-llama logs as they nosh.  But that isn't all of us.  Some of us genuinely care.  You've got at least three of us in this thread now; regular posters who go out of our way to explain what happened, why it happened, and how to keep it from happening again.  We don't judge and we don't condemn people for their mistakes.
